start.description:
Miami.
Capital of the strange 
and the wonderful. 
You've been here all your life, more or less. 
- You've never had much luck here, though. Until today. This is your Miami Story. 
 It starts with a nice morning visit to Versailles Cafe.

versaillesCafe.description:
You're at Versailles Cafe, early morning. A bright morning. 
 You should be doing something. But it's a lazy kind of day. Time for a cortadito. Or two.

vibin.description:
You drink your cortaditos. Maybe even eat a croqueta or two. An hour passes. Maybe two. 
Something's on your mind, though

inAHurry.description:
Something tells you to get out of the Cafe. Just as suddenly as you feel the humid air outside, your phone rings. 
 A reminder that you're supposed to meet your friend Downtown.

onTheMove.description:
You take the trolley to Downtown, Government Center.
- Your friend is at Bayside, not too far of a walk. But you have to hurry.

bayside.description:
Your friend waves at you from the entrance path to Bayside Marketplace. 
-They're leaving Miami tomorrow, so today's a last hangout sort of day. You decide to walk around together for a while

moveBayside.description:
It's been a nice day, all things considered: 
 A lot of free samples at the food court. A lot of Miami merchandise buying, bootleg Miami Heart shirts and all. 
- A lot of silences. But you have to keep moving, it's 7 pm.

endOfBayside.description:
Your friend waves goodbye as you end the night, they have to pack and get ready for their flight. 
-You wander around Downtown, until you find a bar that's open late.

bar.description:
You sit at the bar. 
 You drink. Time passes. You haven't ate much. 
You get drunk fast. You don't talk to anyone.

drunk.description:
It's time to go home 
You order an Uber, a Lyft, whatever you can swipe on your phone.
 There's a full Moon out on the horizon.

end1.description:
You stumble up to your home, and struggle with the keys.
 You barge in, and lock it. You flop onto your bed. 
The end of the day. But could it have been different? Only one way to find out.

stillVibin.description:
You ignore that feeling. You look around Versailles. 
 All the old communities and voices here, cuban and more. It's nice.
 You could stay here a while longer, right?

continueTheVibe.description:
You've been at Versailles for a while now, but no one seems to mind. 
 A camera crew comes in, local news. They want a tourist piece on the place, and the people

newsVibe.description:
Some older folk, Cubans and tourists, flock to the cameras, yelling about liberty, and about Miami. 
You wait and wait, and you get hungry.

food.description:
You sit down inside of the restaurant proper. 
You order a Pan con Bistec, steak sandwich with fries, a plate of rice on the side.
You eat, and you think.

coffee.description:
You finish your food, and it's time for another coffee.
Just as you finish ordering, you hear a crash outside. You don't get up, though.

crash.description:
You hear that an SUV crashed into a light pole.
 You hear that the news captured footage of it. That people scattered.
You drink your coffee.

end2.description:
The rest of the day, and night, goes like that. Sitting, eating, drinking, listening, watching, wondering.
You head home. But you feel like you forgot something.

observe.description:
After a quick breakfast, you feel like it's time to keep moving. 
But your eyes fall on a table near the entrance. A briefcase there, left all alone.

briefcase.description: One quick look at the briefcase, which is slightly open, and you think you've hit the jackpot: cash stacked in neat little piles. No one's looking, right?

takeMoney.description: Just as you're about to close the briefcase, and walk out with the money, something moves quickly on your periphery. You turn, and get pushed.

badMove.description:
A man in a suit, yelling in Spanglish, tells you off. He closes the briefcase and steps out of Versailles.
People stare at you, and you don't stare back. 
That's when you notice something at your feet

score.description:
A stack of bills, bundled up and brand-new, is waiting for you, near your sneakers. 
You play it cool, and pick it up.

end3.description:
You manage to leave the cafe with no one the wiser. 
You high-tail it home, forgetting your plans for the day.
You lay the bundle of bills on your dresser drawer, and settle in for the night.

worry.description:
You're supposed to do something. But you have this weird feeling, goosebumps on the back of your neck. 
-You feel that silent alarm in your mind going off.

wrong.description:
You start pacing and sweating, you feel like people are watching you. But the rest of the people in the cafe pay you no mind.
-You keep worrying, though.

off.description:
You step outside for a moment, and try to catch your breath. 
Someone offers you some water, and you drink it fast.
You still feel off. Maybe this is it, you think.

worryHome.description:
You order an Uber and go home. You ignore texts and calls.
You lay in your bed, and try to watch TV.
But the feeling is still there.

end4.description:
Your worried state of mind leaves you exhausted, and soon to sleep.
You missed out on important stuff, but you can sleep and try again, at least.

help.description:
-Welcome to A Miami Story! Here are some player controls:
- Type the option's text to make a choice.
- Choose the best option to see four different endings. If stuck, remember four commands: move, look, wait, and panic.!
Good luck!

- Type 'back' to return to the previous scene.
Type clear and then restart to start over.
